Communications networks.What is a network: Two or more computers, and often other devices, that are linked together so that they can share hardware and transfer data to each other

Communications networks.What is meant by 'sharing peripheral dev:
The ability to share printers, fax machines, scanners etc amongst network users. 
This is significant as it reduces the total number of devices required in a workplace, saving money and space.
Communications networks.What is meant by 'sharing internet servi:
A single connection to the internet can provide email, web and file access services to all network users. 
This is significant as it allows you to access information at any time
Communications networks.What is meant by 'sharing data and infor:
As a user of a network, people are able to save and retrieve their data to a server on the network. 
This is significant as the data can be made available to other network users, allowing for the easy sharing of data between users.
Communications networks.What is meant by 'sharing network applic:
An application can be stored on a server in a network. 
This is significant as the application can be accessed by users (either by downloading or cloud computing) of the network when they need it, ensuring the users will always be using the most up-to-date version of the application.
Communications networks.What is 'cloud computing': A term used to represent accessing and using applications stored on a server elsewhere on the internet, allowing the user to save storage space and have a server perform computationly expensive tasks rather than the users device.
Communications networks.What is distributed processing: A form of processing in which the computational load is divided amongst multiple computers
